intro: Eremia xeranthemifolia, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is adapted to hot, dry climates and has a deep root system to access underground water. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds, aiding in its propagation in harsh environments.
